title: cmd/godoc: Document how to write examples
body:
There doesn't seem to be any documentation on how to write Godoc examples.  I would
expect to find it either in the cmd/godoc documentation, or in one of the "Godoc:
documenting Go code", "Effective Go", "How to Write Go Code"
documents.  Example questions to answer:

  - What files does godoc look in for examples?
  - How should examples be written?  Can more than one example go in a single file?  Can they be spread over multiple functions?  Use global variables or constants?  Should examples that need different import sets be split into different files?
  - How will they be rendered?
  - Why are some examples shown in a playground sandbox (e.g., http://golang.org/pkg/time/#example_After) while others are not (e.g., http://golang.org/pkg/bytes/#example_Buffer)?
  - Why did the time.After's ExampleAfter example get rewritten as a "func main" example, but the bytes.Buffer example didn't?
  - What's the syntax for sample output like for bytes.Buffer?  Any stylistic advice about when sample output should be used considering how easy the playground makes testing it directly?
